Parameters: The key to update data for. Must be a non-negative integer less than @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#getMaxNumKeys_E@.
The data to store. May be a maximum of @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#getMaxStateSize_E@ bytes.
update(com.google.android.gms.common.api.Description: Updates app state for the current app. The data provided here is developer-specified and can be in any format appropriate for the app. This method updates the local copy of the app state and syncs the changes to the server. If the local data conflicts with the data on the server, this will be indicated the next time you call @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#load_E@. This is the fire-and-forget form of the API. Use this form if you don't need to know the results of the operation immediately. For most applications, this will be the preferred API to use. See @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#updateImmediate_E@ if you need the results delivered to your application. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#SCOPE_APP_STATE_E@
update(com.google.android.gms.common.api.FullName: public static void update (GoogleApiClient googleApiClient, int stateKey, byte[] data)

Returns: @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@ to access the data when available.

delete(com.google.android.gms.common.api.Description: Delete the state data for the current app. This method will delete all data associated with the provided key, as well as removing the key itself. Note that this API is not version safe. This means that it is possible to accidentally delete a user's data using this API. For a version safe alternative, consider using @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#update_E@ with null data instead. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#SCOPE_APP_STATE_E@

Returns: The maximum state size that can be stored with a given state key in bytes.
getMaxStateSize(com.google.android.gms.c.Description: Gets the maximum app state size per state key in bytes. Guaranteed to be at least 256 KB. May increase in the future. If the service cannot be reached for some reason, this will return @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateStatusCodes#STATUS_CLIENT_RECONNECT_REQUIRED_E@. In this case, no further operations should be attempted until after the client has reconnected. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#SCOPE_APP_STATE_E@

Returns: @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@ to access the data when available.
Parameters: The key to resolve data for. Must be a non-negative integer less than @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#getMaxNumKeys_E@.
Version code from previous onStateConflict call.
Data to submit as the current data. null is a valid value here. May be a maximum of @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#getMaxStateSize_E@ bytes.
resolve(com.google.android.gms.common.ap.Description: Resolve a previously detected conflict in app state data. Note that it is still possible to receive a conflict callback after this call. This will occur if data on the server continues to change. In this case, resolution should be retried until a successful status is returned. The value of resolvedVersion passed here must correspond to the value returned from @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#StateConflictResult#getResolvedVersion_E@. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#SCOPE_APP_STATE_E@
resolve(com.google.android.gms.common.ap.FullName: public static PendingResult<AppStateManager.StateResult> resolve (GoogleApiClient googleApiClient, int stateKey, String resolvedVersion, byte[] resolvedData)

Returns: The maximum number of keys that an app can use for data.
getMaxNumKeys(com.google.android.gms.com.Description: Gets the maximum number of keys that an app can store data in simultaneously. If the service cannot be reached for some reason, this will return @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateStatusCodes#STATUS_CLIENT_RECONNECT_REQUIRED_E@. In this case, no further operations should be attempted until after the client has reconnected. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateManager#SCOPE_APP_STATE_E@

ClassDesc: App State APIs are now deprecated. Please use Saved Games instead (https://developers.google.com/games/services/common/concepts/savedgames). Main public API entry point for the AppState APIs.
